page.title: 20RATES RISES
page.content: In 1985 the rateable values of properties in Scotland have been reassessed and in many cases increased by a significant amount. It is according to the rateable values that householders pay a local taxation to fund the local services such as Educt- ation, the Police, refuse collection and Hospitals. Edinburgh has been particularily badly hit by current rates rises and when we questioned local residents about their views, more than 80% of them felt that the quality of the services did not justify rate rises of more than 100%. { Compiled by pupils from St.Denis and {Cranley, Hailesland and Murrayburn {Schools, especially Susan Gow, Andrew {Mackay, Alan Trotter, Hoa Luu, Audrey {Dearn, Leanne Meikle, Nadia Buchan, {Jane Elder, Fiona Allan,Tanya Cowan, {Frances Farish and Lesley Crichton.
